snippet: A long friendship between two couples, all four of whom are well-known architects, is under stress after one couple recommended tearing down a Manhattan museum designed by the other pair.
abstract: Long friendship between two celebrated architect duos--Billie Tsien and Tod Williams and Ricardo Scofidio and Liz Diller--is under stress after Scofidio and Diller recommended tearing down the former home of the American Folk Art Museum, which Tsien and Williams designed; proposal is part of the expansion for the Museum of Modern Art; industry experts say they cannot recall an instance when one set of architects took down another's celebrated building just a few years after it went up.
lead_paragraph: A long friendship between two couples, all four of whom are well-known architects, is under stress after one couple recommended tearing down a Manhattan museum designed by the other pair.

headline.main: Building Faces Wrecking Ball. So Does Couples’ Friendship.
headline.print_headline: Building Faces Wrecking Ball. So Does Couples’ Friendship.
